segment.source: How to Migrate Extension Points From an App-V 4.6 Package to App-V 5.0 for a Specific User
segment.target: How to Migrate Extension Points From an App-V 4.6 Package to App-V 5.0 for a Specific User

segment.source: How to Migrate Extension Points From an App-V 4.6 Package to App-V 5.0 for a Specific User
segment.target: How to Migrate Extension Points From an App-V 4.6 Package to App-V 5.0 for a Specific User

segment.source: How to Migrate Extension Points From an App-V 4.6 Package to App-V 5.0 for a Specific User
segment.target: How to Migrate Extension Points From an App-V 4.6 Package to App-V 5.0 for a Specific User

segment.source: Note:* App-V 4.6 has exited Mainstream support.
segment.target: Note:* App-V 4.6 has exited Mainstream support.

segment.source: Use the following procedure to migrate packages created with App-V using the user configuration file.
segment.target: Use the following procedure to migrate packages created with App-V using the user configuration file.

segment.source: To convert a package
segment.target: To convert a package

segment.source: Locate the user configuration file for the package you want to convert.
segment.target: Locate the user configuration file for the package you want to convert.

segment.source: To set the policy, perform the following updates in the userConfiguration section: ManagingAuthority TakeoverExtensionPointsFrom46="true" PackageName=Package ID.
segment.target: To set the policy, perform the following updates in the userConfiguration section: ManagingAuthority TakeoverExtensionPointsFrom46="true" PackageName=Package ID.

segment.source: The following is an example of a user configuration file:
segment.target: The following is an example of a user configuration file:

segment.source: ?xml version="1.0" ?
segment.target: ?xml version="1.0" ?

segment.source: UserConfiguration PackageId=Package ID DisplayName=Name of the Package
segment.target: UserConfiguration PackageId=Package ID DisplayName=Name of the Package

segment.source: xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/appv/2010/userconfiguration"ManagingAuthority TakeoverExtensionPointsFrom46="true"
segment.target: xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/appv/2010/userconfiguration"ManagingAuthority TakeoverExtensionPointsFrom46="true"

segment.source: PackageName=Package ID
segment.target: PackageName=Package ID

segment.source: /UserConfiguration
segment.target: /UserConfiguration

segment.source: To add the App-V 5.0 package type the following in an elavted PowerShell command prompt:
segment.target: To add the App-V 5.0 package type the following in an elavted PowerShell command prompt:

segment.source: PS$pkg= Add-AppvClientPackage –PathPath to package location
segment.target: PS$pkg= Add-AppvClientPackage –PathPath to package location

segment.source: PSPublish-AppVClientPackage $pkg -DynamicUserConfigurationPath to the user configuration file
segment.target: PSPublish-AppVClientPackage $pkg -DynamicUserConfigurationPath to the user configuration file

segment.source: Open the application using FTAs or shortcuts now.
segment.target: Open the application using FTAs or shortcuts now.

segment.source: The application should open using App-V 5.0.
segment.target: The application should open using App-V 5.0.

segment.source: The App-V SP2 package and the converted App-V 5.0 package are published to the user, but the FTAs and shortcuts for the applications have been assumed by the App-V 5.0 package.
segment.target: The App-V SP2 package and the converted App-V 5.0 package are published to the user, but the FTAs and shortcuts for the applications have been assumed by the App-V 5.0 package.

segment.target: Got a suggestion for App-V?
